Thank you for all your help.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T14:58:10.828Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":42,"reads":184,"readers_count":183,"score":246.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484904,"topic_slug":"fabric-for-bumpers","display_username":"Ken Bentley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72089,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/fabric-for-bumpers/484904/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3500670,"name":" (Data Wrangler) (Event Volunteer)","username":"mmongar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/3e96dc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T15:32:47.107Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eYou are looking for an outdoor nylon or polyester canvas type denier material. They don’t have a huge quantity of that type of material in the colors you want at those stores in my area. You might be better to buy Cordura 1000D Nylon online (Amazon, Rockywoods Fabric, Seattle Fabric, Xtreme Sight Line)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOther fabrics people have tried are Sailcloth/Dacron which is slick but it has no stretch (Sailrite, Sailmaker)\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T15:32:47.107Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":82.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484904,"topic_slug":"fabric-for-bumpers","display_username":" (Data Wrangler) (Event Volunteer)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43295,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/fabric-for-bumpers/484904/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3500822,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T18:02:16.152Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003e\u003ca class=\"mention\" href=\"/u/mmongar\"\u003e@mmongar\u003c/a\u003e is correct, these stores are not generally good places to get bumper fabric, since what you need isn’t something they typically carry in the stores. If you want to use fabric like the stuff that Andymark sells, then it’s the 1000D nylon, which we always \u003ca href=\"https://www.seattlefabrics.com/60-1000-D-Cordura-Nylon-1895-linear-yard_p_53.html\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003ebought from Seattle Fabrics\u003c/a\u003e (note that the red and blue colors are, in fact, designated as \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eFIRST\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e Robotics Red and \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eFIRST\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e Robotics Blue.) In recent years, we’ve been one of the teams that has switched to using Dacron sailcloth for it’s slickness and repairability. We get this from \u003ca href=\"https://www.sailmakerssupply.com/product/colored-dacron-sailcloth/sailcloth\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eSailmaker’s Supply\u003c/a\u003e, in the Red and Dark Blue colors (the Medium Blue is too light to be a good match for the standard bumper blue.) We also buy \u003ca href=\"https://www.sailmakerssupply.com/product/insignia-cloth/sailcloth\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eInsignia Cloth\u003c/a\u003e from them, which is Dacron sailcloth with a very aggressive adhesive backing. We use it both in white to cut out our bumper numbers (using a vinyl cutter like a Cricut) and as repair patches in red and blue. Once you stick that stuff on, it really doesn’t come off and it makes bumper repair really easy in the pits.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T18:02:40.560Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":73.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484904,"topic_slug":"fabric-for-bumpers","display_username":"Stewart I was on a tight schedule and forced to buy bumper fabric at a craft store I’d probably end up getting duck canvas, but you’d be much better off with a heavy cordura or one of the more exotic fabrics.  I’ve had some very bad experiences with sailcloth tearing easily, but others have liked it. I use VX-21 pack cloth because it’s pretty slick and wear resistant with good rip stop. But rip stop is not the same as cut or puncture resistant, you can definitely puncture or slash VX-21 but those holes rarely propagate across the reinforcing
